body:
'any_combination_of' expects a sequence of objects, but was getting a single
iterable object (PR #9481).

This should fix and improve #9934, which was messed up by a fetch from `develop`.

There are some new versions of RegCM available:
```python
    version('4.7.1-SVN6916',
            sha256='cad66b760464b513afd318eb28a6820a0d4c8c55d3b23a34d06cb9c1b57aa0bc',
            url='http://clima-dods.ictp.it/Users/ggiulian/RegCM-SVN6916.tar.gz')
    version('4.7.0-SVN6884',
            sha256='fd4eb0fbe911c6c4dacbaaf2a952a45ac8c1fa54a5d905972ffe592e47818c00',
            url='http://clima-dods.ictp.it/Users/ggiulian/RegCM-SVN6884.tar.gz')
```
A new "official" version has not been released yet.

The latest version provides a partial support to `pnetcdf` (direct support, without using `netcdf`, would cost more developing time).
title: RegCM: intel FC 'hint', 4.7.0 intel warning, fcflags, fix extensions.
